holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year's Day is the first day of the year in France.

holidays.name: Good Friday
holidays.description: Good Friday is an occasion for Christians in France to commemorate Jesus Christ’s crucifixion.

holidays.name: Easter Sunday
holidays.description: Many Christians in France celebrate Jesus Christ's resurrection on Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Easter Monday
holidays.description: Easter Monday is the day after Easter Sunday.

holidays.name: Labor Day / May Day
holidays.description: People in France give loved ones flowers and may celebrate or campaign for workers' rights on May Day, also known as Labor Day.

holidays.name: WWII Victory Day
holidays.description: WWII Victory Day marks the anniversary of the official end of World War II and is a public holiday in France.

holidays.name: Mother's Day
holidays.description: Mothers and mother figures are honored with cards, gifts and other acts of kindness on Mothers’ Day in France.

holidays.name: Ascension Day
holidays.description: Ascension Day marks the day that Jesus ascended to heaven, according to Christian belief.

holidays.name: Whit Sunday
holidays.description: Pentecost Sunday is 50 days after Easter Sunday. It marks the Holy Spirit's descent onto Jesus' followers, according to Christian belief.

holidays.name: Whit Monday
holidays.description: Pentecost Monday is the day after Pentecost Sunday. It is a public holiday in France.

holidays.name: Father's Day
holidays.description: Families across France remember their fathers and father figures on Fathers’ Day on the third Sunday in June.

holidays.name: Bastille Day
holidays.description: Bastille Day is an occasion to honor the French Republic. It is a public holiday in France.

holidays.name: Assumption of Mary
holidays.description: The Feast of the Assumption of Mary is an occasion for Catholics to honor the belief that God assumed the Virgin Mary to heaven.

holidays.name: All Saints' Day
holidays.description: All Saints' Day celebrates all Christian saints, particularly those who have no special feast days of their own. It is a public holiday in France.

holidays.name: Armistice Day
holidays.description: Armistice Day marks the anniversary of the end of World War I. It is a public holiday in France.

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Christmas Eve is the day before Christmas Day and is an important occasion for many French families.

holidays.name: Christmas Day
holidays.description: Christmas Day is an occasion for Christians to celebrate Jesus Christ's birth. It is public holiday in France.

holidays.name: St Stephen's Day
holidays.description: St Stephen's Day is an occasion for Christians to honor St Stephen's life and is a public holiday in France's Alsace-Moselle region.

holidays.name: New Year's Eve
holidays.description: New Year’s Eve is the last day of the year, December 31, in the Gregorian calendar.
